subject: Re: Next 820/goldBox Installment
author: Steve Hultay
full_text:
Yeah, that's what i did too.  But it's recorded, EVP maker is a 
recorded piece jumbled into a live situation.  I say try everything, 
i have.  Some stuff works better than others, but it can't hurt to 
experiment with methods.

-Steve

method I

the

> Marty

> > > Andy, thanks for the compliments, much appreciated.  Main credit

roadwork

> > > inspiration.  My main concern design wise for this was to have a
> > > version that was compartmentalized ("plug and play" if you 
will) so
> > > that components can be easily substituted for experimenting.  
Plus
> > > something lower powered to make it more portable, hence the 
idea to
> > > use a low power speaker powered by the input device, and a
> > > corresponding hearing assistance device as the mic/amp to amp 
it 
> > up. 
> > > Once the lid is on, this thing is *loud* but clear.  In fact, I 
have
> > > the amp set to min volume and its still a little to loud to 
listen 
> > to
> > > with headphones sometimes unless you play around with 
equalizing the
> > > volume settings on the 820 and the speaker.
> > > 
> > > I'm also going to be experimenting swapping out the 820 with an 
iPod
> > > shuffle containing a lengthy pre-recorded sound file of audio.  
30
> > > second talk (maybe me reading the alphabet or something), 
chopped up
> > > with EVP-Maker, and then spliced out to repeat for 30 minutes 
or 
> > so. 
> > > I realize, as Frank stated previously, that they can effect 
sound
> > > anywhere including in a control sound like this as its being 
> > recorded
> > > or mixed.  But my concern is satisfying the "skeptics" out 
there 
> > who,
> > > as you put it when you first joined the group, feel that using 
the
> > > radio input it "would be hard to distinguish from 
coincidence".  A
> > > controlled input that can be referred back to for comparison 
would
> > > satisfy that qualification that keeps getting thrown up.

> > > Marty
